basics.label: Web Developer
basics.name: Tom Bremer
basics.summary: I am a web developer and user advocate. I believe in making the web accessible, performant, and easy to use.

highlights: Build, test, and deploy web and mobile applications that meet client requirements while maintaining best practices related to accessibility and web performance.

Coach and train teams, individual contributors, and clients with a range of experience in JavaScript/Typescript runtimes (browsers, nodejs, and deno), CSS (PostCSS and Sass), HTML, WCAG accessibility guidelines, performance tuning, and design systems.
Create and facilitate various training activities including an in-person/remote two day ReactJS deep-dive.
Worked with the wider WWT Leadership group to build a career matrix, promotion process, and update the Frontend Engineer, User Research, and UX Design interview processes.
Integral in full site redesign and on going maintenance of the design system including developer workflows with GruntJS, frontend framework/pattern library used by fullstack engineers.
Contributed to CSS and Sass based solutions to eliminate JavaScript based DOM manipulations and animations

A/B test engineer with experience in content variance, performance tuning (pagespeed, TTFB, TTL, first meaningful paint, and time to interactive), and user experience optimizations, including creating long-lived tests on new and existing websites.
work.summary: User Experience developer, A/B Test Engineer, UX Tech Stack
